modules.html:
What does SER express?

SER expresses something or someone's essence. Any quality or attribute that defines how that essence is perceived by someone can be expressed with SER.
⚠️Careful with the word "permanent" when talking about SER

Many teachers, materials, or even influencers might tell you that SER is used for "permanent" traits. Seems simple, right? At first it seems to hold up. Most characteristcs that are more "permanent" can be attributed just fine with SER, but it can also cause confusion.

Let’s take this sentence:

Guadalajara está en Jalisco, México.
Guadalajara is in Jalisco, Mexico.

Wait—location seems pretty permanent. Cities don’t teleport. So why use ESTAR instead of SER?

Because location is not part of what a city is, conceptually speaking—it's part of where it is. That’s a situational context, not an identity trait. We're not describing what Guadalajara is like—we're situating it! More on this later on!

Let's take another sentence:

Era bastante tímido cuando era niño.
I was pretty shy when I was a kid.

Well, I was shy but I'm not anymore, so why can't I just say "estaba tímido"?

Because we're describing how someone was perceived, how they were as a person at that time. It’s about identity, not a fleeting emotion or reaction. Even if it changed later, it was their essence then.

There's nothing that says essence is fixed forever—it can evolve. As Eduardo Galeano put it:

Somos lo que hacemos para cambiar lo que somos.
We are what we do to change what we are.

Explore Examples of Common Attributes that Mark Essence

Identity
Juan y Carla son mis mejores amigos.
Juan and Carla are my best friends.

Esta película es mi favorita.
This movie is my favorite.

Origin

Mi abuela es de México.
My grandmother is from Mexico.

Estos vinos son de Argentina.
These wines are from Argentina.

Brand
Mi celular es un iPhone.
My cell is an iPhone.

Esos zapatos son Nike.
Those shoes are Nike.

Personality

Mi hermana es muy extrovertida.
My sister is very outgoing.

Marcos es una persona muy paciente.
Marcos is a very patient person.

Material

Esta mesa es de madera.
This table is made of wood.

Mis anillos son de plata.
My rings are made of silver.

Color

Mi coche es rojo.
My car is red.

Estas paredes son blancas.
These walls are white.

Qualities

El café es amargo sin azúcar.
Coffee is bitter without sugar.

Su voz es muy suave.
Her/His voice is very soft.

Profession

Mi papá es médico.
My dad is a doctor.

Ellos son profesores de historia.
They are history teachers.

Personal Relationships

Carolina es mi prima.
Carolina is my cousin.

Nosotros somos novios.
We're a couple (boyfriend & girlfriend/boyfriends)

Category

Los gatos son mamíferos.
Cats are mammals.

Este libro es una novela de ciencia ficción.
This book is a science fiction novel.

Shape

La mesa es redonda.
The table is round.

Mis gafas son rectangulares.
My glasses are rectangular.

Dates

Hoy es martes.
Today is Tuesday.

Mi cumpleaños es el 10 de abril.
My birthday is on April 10th.

Times

Ahora es la una y media de la tarde.
Right now, it is 1:30 in the afternoon.

Son las 17 horas. / Son las cinco de la tarde.
It’s 5:00 pm.

La reunión es a las cinco.
The meeting is at five.


What does ESTAR express?

ESTAR expresses someone or something’s situation. This can include any temporary state, condition, or location that is experienced, perceived, or subject to change. It reflects how that person or thing is situated in a specific moment or context—physically, emotionally, or circumstantially—rather than what defines their essence.
Explore Examples of Common Situations that Mark ESTAR

Location (Physical Presence)

Mi mochila está en el auto.
My backpack is in the car.

Ellos están en la sala de reuniones.
They are in the meeting room.

Emotional State

Hoy estoy muy contenta.
Today I'm very happy.

Mi hermano está un poco triste.
My brother is a little sad.

Physical Condition

El café está caliente.
The coffee is hot.

La computadora está apagada.
The computer is off.

Health

Estoy muy agotada.
I’m exhausted.

Mi abuela está enferma.
My grandmother is sick.

Ongoing Actions (Progressive Aspect)

Estoy estudiando para el examen.
I am studying for the exam.

Ellos están trabajando en el proyecto.
They are working on the project.

Weather / Environmental Conditions

Está un poco nublado hoy.
It’s a bit cloudy today.

¿Cómo está el clima allá?
How’s the weather over there?

Marital / Relationship Status

Mis padres están casados.
My parents are married.

Estoy divorciado.
I'm divorced.

*SER can be used with casado, divorciado, and soltero when describing civil status as a social category or identity (essence). We'll cover this more in depth later on when we look at SER and ESTAR with adjectives.

Appearances Traits Marking a Sudden Change

Marta está muy guapa hoy.
Marta looks very pretty today.

Ese actor está más delgado últimamente.
That actor looks thinner lately.

Situational Reactions

¡Esta torta está riquísima!
This cake is delicious!

Tu presentación estuvo excelente.
Your presentation was excellent.

Availability / Presence

Lo siento, el director no está ahora.
Sorry, the director isn't here right now.

Podés sentarte acá, está libre la silla.
You can sit here, the chair’s free.

Dead or Alive

Mi abuelo ya no está.
My grandfather is no longer with us.

¿Está viva la planta?
Is the plant alive?

Below is a brief overview of the core concepts of SER and ESTAR. As you study the examples, notice how SER consistently marks essence, while ESTAR consistently marks situation. 

¡A practicar!
modules.title: The Basics of SER & ESTAR
Other Equivalents of 'to be' in Spanish besides SER & ESTAR

title: SER, ESTAR, and Other Equivalents of TO BE: A complete guide
